message: I have never seen such a barrier.

replies.text: I should examine it further. Maybe I can get into it anywhere?
I should tell Miri of all this.

message: You stumble upon a piece of paper.

replies.text: Oh, I have seen this paper before. It is a part of the Kazaul ritual! I should talk to Miri about all this.

message: The barrier feels rather massive.

replies.text: I'm here. Miri isn't. Well, I can't wait. Let's chant.

message: As soon as you have finished, the barrier fades away.
Oh, a new guest in this sad establishment.
Ah, one of the kids who've been causing trouble around Dhayavar.
Yes, I know of you. And a bit on what your brother has been up to.
Information is for the trustworthy.
By switching Gandoren's shipment with degraded ones, you have proved not to be. Suffice to say, your brother has been up to shenanigans in Feyguard last when I was there.

replies.text: How would you know that I did such things?

message: As an investigator, it's my job to know. Now, buzz off, kid. Redeem yourself, if you can.
Information is for the trustworthy.
By hiding the truth of Beer Bootlegging from Sullengard, you have proved not to be. Suffice to say, your brother has been up to shenanigans in Feyguard last when I was there.

replies.text: How would you know that I did such things?

message: Information is for a price.
You've aided Feyguard once before. Now, run a detection for me. If you succeed, I'll tell you what I know of Andor.

replies.text: So, what do you want from me?

message: While investigating the forests east of Sullengard, slitherers got to me. Nasty little slitherers. Damned beasts.
I need to recover from the nausea and poison.

replies.text: Can I help you with some potions?

message: No, thanks. I've already taken some potions, waiting for them to take effect.
But there's something bad happening in the lands south of Stoutford, and if we don't stop it, not only Feyguard, but whole Dhayavar will be in trouble.
Yeah - many weird things going on. But no time to waste.
In the lands south of Stoutford, there have been reports of some suspicious activities. It is said to happen in the blue hills there.
I fear if left unchecked, we might see lots of really unstoppable monsters popping up all over Dhayavar.
Admirable - but only few in Dhayavar have the skills to go toe-to-toe against these monsters. No, we must stop them at the source.
Journey to the south of Stoutford, into the weird lands there. Investigate what's going on in the Blue Hills.

replies.text: OK, I'm off. Stoutford, I haven't been there in a long time ...

message: Head south through Stoutford. The Blue Hills lie between the lake landscape and the mountains further south.
You could also go west from Sullengard, but the route is longer.

replies.text: And how do I know that I am there?

message: That's easy. The Blue Hills aren't just called that; they really are bright blue.
Ah, you're back. Too soon - ran into any issue?

replies.text: There's some sort of force shield blocking the path.

message: And? There must be more to it.

replies.text: And I found this piece of Kazaul Ritual again.

message: Search thoroughly around this force shield if you find anything curious.
What do you mean - again?

replies.text: I had used this, on the guidance of Throdna, as part of purifying the Kazaul shrine.

message: That is bad news indeed. We must act.
Go meet Throdna. Since he's known to ramble, just say 'Kazaul est' to focus him again.
Exactly. Hurry now.
What did you find from Throdna?

replies.text: We have talked about the rest of the spell to break the barrier for Kazaul.
Apart from two parts of the spell which I know, the rest of the spell to break the barrier for Kazaul is in the book Calomyran Secrets.

message: [Rolling eyes] That's not much. Go, talk to Throdna again.
here can this book be found?

replies.text: I know! I helped find this book for that old man in Fallhaven. He must still have it. Let me talk to him.

message: Good thinking! Do that, seek the old man with the book.
Any news about the Calomyran Secrets?

replies.text: I got more of the chant but I need to find another book, Azimyran Secrets, for the rest of the chant.

message: Where can that book be found?
No worries. I'm healed enough now.
You have run around enough. Let me ask around. Why don't you rest? Take a nap!
Ah, you're back.
About the Azimyran Secrets? Yes, my sources were most informative
There's an Old Hermit who lives in the hills near the Arulir monsters. He's said to have a copy of Azimyran Secrets. Go ...
Go and get it.
Have you found the complete chant?

replies.text: I haven't even found the old hermit yet.
I found the old hermit, but he hasn't given me his book.

message: You'll have to put in a little more effort. All of Dhajavar trusts you.
He must. Go again.
Great. And now off to the barrier! Make haste - I'll join you as fast as my injuries allow.
[Smiling] What an eager kid.
It's not done yet. Can you talk to this priest? And tackle him as he has earned?
The monster is not dead. Go and finish it!
Finally. Well done, kid.
This is over, yes.
And now for your reward.

replies.text: Yes? Hope it is worth it.

message: You are still looking for your brother?
I know where he is. Or better, where he will be soon.
Andor is going to visit Rosmara in Brimhaven to refill his travel supplies.
[mumbling chants]
Nooooo!
Why did you do that?  Who gave you the right?

replies.text: Do you know what you were doing?

message: I was getting my husband back from the afterlife!
Is that what you think?
I came with all haste. Too bad the poison is slowing me down.
[To the mourning woman] The ritual was not to bring back your husband - it is to bring Kazaul's powerful monsters into Dhayavar.
You lie! You don't want my happiness.
Do you think monsters would have assisted you? And a barrier would have sprung up? Just for one person?
I don't believe you.
Then why did the ritual not include something that links to your husband?  Something precious to him?
Oh no! What do I do now? He's gone.
Pray where have you been praying. And tell me who put you up to this?

replies.text: Yes, who put you up to this?

message: Why? That famous miracle priest who walks on lava, west of here.
We will have a chat with this man. And you go back to your village.
Go away. Leave me alone.
I thought hiding on this hill would ensure no riff-raff would find me.
This tower has long been deserted after all.

replies.text: I'm no riff-raff, and I'm not here to see the sights. I've come to meet you.

message: Leave me alone. I am no one.

replies.text: You are not no one. You have a copy of Azimyran Secrets.

message: So? I'm not giving to anyone. I'm too old to be threatened. And I want nothing.

replies.text: Can I at least read it? I need to copy only one chant.

message: Kazaul again, eh?
Hehe. I'm a hermit, but not senile. In fact, I moved here to stay away from all those holier-than-thou morons: Geomyr, Shadow, Elythom ...

replies.text: Sounds oddly appealing. Can I copy the rest of the chant?

message: Sure. Here you go.

replies.text:
[Flipping through the pages] Ah, here's the rest of chant.
[Talking to the hermit]: Thanks! Here's the book back.

message: Welcome! Try and not disturb me again, if you can.

replies.text: Unless my brother comes this way, we won't disturb you again.

message: Who are you? Not here to steal my books, are you?

replies.text: I once have helped find your book. Don't be rude!

message: Sorry, there seem to be folks who want to take my books and not return them.

replies.text: In fact, I'd like to borrow your copy of Calomyran Secrets.

message: No can do. It's too rare and precious.
Sounds serious. But, what's the book to do with that?

replies.text: I need a chant from it to break a Kazaul spell.

message: Copy it out then.
Are you finished at last?

replies.text: [Talking to self, while reading] So, this is the chant. Wait, this is half a chant! The books says the rest of the chant is written in another book - Azimyran Secrets.

message: And stop babbling to yourself!

replies.text: Done. Here's your book back, thank you.

message: Do I see greasy fingerprints there?

replies.text: However, it is not complete. Do you also have the book Azimyran Secrets?

message: No, sorry. Do let me know if you come across a copy.
You keep on disturbing us?

replies.text: How did you manage to lose this? [Gives Throdna the second piece of the Kazaul Ritual]

message: Why did you steal this? You must be part of those terrible cult of the Kazaul.
Where was I? Ah, yes ...
O Kazaul, venerabilis deus, where art thou in the shadows of tempus ...
... Sacra ritus, anciente, must be reawakened, sed obscure ...
... Lumen in tenebris, the sigil of Kazaul, lost in the mists of memoria ...
... Perhaps the incantatio of the ancients holds the key, sed forgotten ...

replies.text: What was the word again? Ah, I remember. [Loud voice] Kazaul Est!

message: You are still here? Well ...
So, you're not the one who stole my notes?

replies.text: No, in fact I helped purify the shrine.

message: That is right… So, what do you want?

replies.text: I need to know what all this chant can do.

message: It's a powerful chant for many dangerous things. I'm not sure I should tell. Followers of Kazaul want to get a foothold in Dhayavar. [lapses back into rambling]
The ritual of the nocturnus, should it be performed under luna’s watchful eye ...
... Ego dubito, whether the offerings still hold power, or are but relics of a bygone era ...

[snapping out of ramble] This piece of the Ritual is of Kazaul. Along with the first part, one can raise Kazaul monsters, use in sacrifices, make defensive walls, impenetrable barriers ... dangerous rites.

replies.text: I just came from such an impenetrable barrier in the south of Stoutford.

message: An impenetrable barrier? That's no good. If Kazaul gains a foothold in Dhayavar, strong monsters will roam in Dhayavar. [lapses into rambling]
... Is the tempus ripe for the reawakening of Kazaul, or is it but an illusion ...
... Must find the correct verba, the sacred words that summon the divine ...
... Kazaul’s essence, hidden within the arcana of the old scrolls, waiting to be uncovered ...
Eh, yes. The barrier. One has to use the two pieces of the ritual and a chant of passage to go through the barrier.

replies.text: What is the chant of passage?

message: That is something I do not know.
I didn't say that! There was a traveler a long time back - he wrote a book Calomyran Secrets. It has the chant of passage, among other things to counter Kazaul dangers. Find it, if you can.

replies.text: Calomyran Secrets? That rings a bell. Thanks!

message: ... Ah, the anciente scriptura, perhaps it reveals the secret to rekindling the divine ...
How dare you stop my spell?
I have no time for this.
You again? This must end now.
You’re no priest!
Could not let you go alone.

replies.text: You made me fight alone my way to here.

message: Don’t worry – it’s worth it.
Can someone please finally deal with me?
That's its true form! Monster masquerading as a priest! Attack!
